page.title: 02LAND USE AROUND MILDENHALL
page.content: The Mildenhall area is a mainly agricultural one. The region is split across the middle by the{River Kennet and the A4. In the extreme west is the edge of the town of Marlborough, and there are villages along the road and river at{Mildenhall}and{Axford. To the south of the road and river the land is quite hilly and is mainly rough grassland used as permanent pasture for sheep and cattle. This leads up to{Savernake Forest,}which just touches the south of our area. This is a very ancient forest, though the avenues of beech trees were planted in the 18th century. To the north of the road and river and around Stitchcombe the land is used for{arable farming}growing wheat and barley, and for pasture. There are water_meadows along the river, and there is a{trout farm}and a{vineyard.
